{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

globalEvents.name: Open Crate 1
globalEvents.eventText:
You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

globalEvents.name: Mission Briefing
globalEvents.eventText:
It sickens you a little to work with criminals, but it seems worth it to steal from the Empire and fund the Rebellion.

"Just stick this in the main computer and it'll take care of the rest." Your contact hands you a data crystal. "You'll have to stick around to let the transfer run." She gives a nasty grin. "Just don't expect the security response to be gentle."

{-} Deploy the heroes to the blue highlighted space.
{-} Doors are locked. Any figure can attack a door (Health: 5, Defense: 1 {G}).
{-} The mission will progress when the main computer is discovered.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

globalEvents.name: End of Mission - Rebels win
globalEvents.eventText:
With the continuing intensity of  response, you deem it best to make your departure and secure your new finances.

Your partner never shows up to the rendezvous, and when you examine the account, you understand why. It seems the proportions were a little different than you were promised. There is very little remaining in the account, the rest of it drawn away.

{-} The heroes receive 100 credits per hero for every 3 mission tokens they have claimed (maximum 12 tokens).
{-} For every 3 unclaimed mission token, the Empire begins the next mission with an additional 2 {D}.
{-} Each hero receives 1 XP. Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.

globalEvents.name: End of Mission - Rebels lose
globalEvents.eventText:
With the continuing intensity of  response, you deem it best to make your departure and secure your new finances.

Your partner never shows up to the rendezvous, and when you examine the account, you understand why. It seems the proportions were a little different than you were promised. There is very little remaining in the account, the rest of it drawn away.

{-} The heroes receive 100 credits per hero for every 3 mission tokens they have claimed (maximum 12 tokens).

entityProperties.name: Crate4

eventActions.theText:
You start to slice into the main computer.

Test {I} and enter the number of successes. Apply +1 {B} for each strain token placed on the terminal, then discard all strain tokens from the terminal.

inputList.theText:
The security protocols are too tight. You need to keep trying.

{-} Place 1 strain token on the token for each {B} result gained.

globalEvents.name: The Virus
globalEvents.eventText:
It's hard to tell if the siphoning software has kicked in until a deafening alarm blares within the complex and surrounding grounds. External cameras show a fair number of guards responding. Blast doors close to shield the facility.

{-} Set aside 12 neutral mission tokens.
{-} A door adjacent to a Rebel figure does not block his movement or line of sight.
{-} Imperial figures outside of the facility will attack doors instead of Rebel figures until both doors are destroyed.
{-} If there is not a healthy Rebel figure within 2 spaces of a terminal, an Imperial figure can disable and discard it when instructed.
{-} At the end of each round, heroes claim 1 neutral mission token for each terminal on the map.
{-} The Rebels win when they have claimed all 12 mission tokens.

eventActions.theText:
{-} Set aside 12 neutral mission tokens.
{-} A door adjacent to a Rebel figure does not block his movement or line of sight.
{-} If there is not a healthy Rebel figure within 2 spaces of a terminal, an Imperial figure can disable and discard it when instructed.
{-} At the end of each round, heroes claim 1 neutral mission token for each terminal on the map.
{-} The Rebels win when they have claimed all 12 mission tokens.
Defend the main computer until the transaction is complete (&Tokens claimed&/12)

entityProperties.name: Door 1
entityProperties.theText:
A sturdy door leads into the facility.

The door is locked. Any figure can attack a door (Health: 5, Defense: 1 {G}).

entityProperties.name: Door 2
entityProperties.theText:
A sturdy door leads into the facility.

The door is locked. Any figure can attack a door (Health: 5, Defense: 1 {G}).

entityProperties.name: Terminal 1
entityProperties.theText:
Figures run over the computer's screen, to quickly to make out any details.

If there is not a healthy Rebel figure within 2 spaces of a terminal, an Imperial figure can disable and discard it when instructed.

eventActions.theText: Be adjacent to the next terminal (only figures without "Massive" or "Non-Sentient").
{-} Discard an adjacent terminal (only figures without "Massive" and "Non-Sentient").

globalEvents.name: Discard Door 1
globalEvents.eventText: After a few blasts, the door flies open.

entityProperties.theText:

globalEvents.name: Discard Door 2
globalEvents.eventText: After a few blasts, the door flies open.

entityProperties.name: Door 2
entityProperties.theText:
A sturdy door leads into the facility.

The door is locked. Any figure can attack a door (Health: 5, Defense: 1 {G}).

globalEvents.name: Clear the Area
globalEvents.eventText:
Behind the door lies a server room with three humming computer cores. 

Guards ready their weapons as you approach.

eventActions.theText:
{-} A Rebel figure can interact with a terminal to upload the virus.
{-} The mission will progress when the virus is uploaded.

globalEvents.name: Discard Terminal 1
globalEvents.eventText: Under the attacks, the computer door quickly collapses, stopping part of the transfer.

entityProperties.name: Terminal 1
entityProperties.theText:
The access core of the main computer hums softly.

A Rebel figure can interact with it to upload the virus.

globalEvents.name: Threat increase
globalEvents.eventText: Alarms keep blaring, alerting reinforcements. Soon you will be overwhelmed.

globalEvents.name: Terminal 1 Tokens
globalEvents.eventText:
The first computer core keeps processing the transfer.

Claim 1 neutral mission token.

globalEvents.name: Terminal 2 Tokens
globalEvents.eventText:
The second computer core keeps processing the transfer.

Claim 1 neutral mission token.

The third computer core keeps processing the transfer.

Claim 1 neutral mission token.
